comments.creator: nrthomas@gmail.com
comments.text:
Since this is coming from 'make upload' it's something that belongs in a build system component. There are other bugs on file too, eg bug 527740, bug 634051

NB: There are three instances in the source
 http://mxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/search?string=dpkg-architecture
so we hit it in xulrunner builds as well.
comments.author: nrthomas@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
Since this is coming from 'make upload' it's something that belongs in a build system component. There are other bugs on file too, eg bug 527740, bug 634051

NB: There are three instances in the source
 http://mxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/search?string=dpkg-architecture
so we hit it in xulrunner builds as well.

Two things to note:
- It doesn't look like mobile/installer/Makefile.in and xulrunner/installer/Makefile.in actually use the result of dpkg-architecture. Not in a way that matters anyway.
- Using dpkg-architecture the way it is used is actually wrong, because the result possibly doesn't match the actual target for which the build was done. For example, we could be building for i686 on an x86-64 machine, and dpkg-architecture would return amd64.
comments.text:
Two things to note:
- It doesn't look like mobile/installer/Makefile.in and xulrunner/installer/Makefile.in actually use the result of dpkg-architecture. Not in a way that matters anyway.
- Using dpkg-architecture the way it is used is actually wrong, because the result possibly doesn't match the actual target for which the build was done. For example, we could be building for i686 on an x86-64 machine, and dpkg-architecture would return amd64.
comments.author: mh+mozilla@glandium.org
comments.creator: mh+mozilla@glandium.org

comments.text: Now that we're no longer supporting Maemo as a tier1/2 platform, we can probably remove this from the makefiles.
comments.author: aki@mozilla.com
comments.creator: aki@mozilla.com
